content.title: Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm Surveillance
content.definition: Evidence-based surveillance intervals and thresholds for elective repair of abdominal aortic aneurysms.

concepts.definition: Ultrasound surveillance frequency based on aneurysm diameter.

clinical_features.threshold_for_repair: ≥5.5 cm in men, ≥5.0 cm in women

concepts.definition: Criteria for recommending elective AAA repair.

clinical_features.saccular: Consider earlier repair for saccular aneurysms

concepts.definition: USPSTF recommendations for one-time ultrasound screening.

clinical_features.grade_b: Men 65-75 years who have ever smoked
clinical_features.grade_c: Men 65-75 years who have never smoked (selective)
clinical_features.grade_i: Women 65-75 years who have ever smoked (insufficient evidence)
clinical_features.grade_d: Women who have never smoked (do not screen)

concepts.definition: Expected aneurysm expansion and factors affecting growth.

clinical_features.imaging_modality: Ultrasound preferred for surveillance, CT for preoperative planning

diagnostic_criteria.measurement: Outer wall to outer wall, perpendicular to axis

content.statement: Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm Surveillance is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Aortic that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm Surveillance.
